cause.description:
The Open Source Initiative (OSI) is a USA non-profit corporation devoted to promoting open software development, representing users and developers, and protecting the term 'Open Source' from dilution or misuse. The OSI also evaluates software licences against the Open Software Definition in order to determine whether they are truly 'open source' or not. See http://OpenSource.Org/
1. Software developers are entitled to say how their work may be distributed.
2. Open Source software is a positive market force.
cause.name: Open Source Initiative (OSI)
